author: sclongjohnson
body: They lobbied our congress out of automating our taxes years ago. Fuck Intuit and Fuck H&R Block

author: Im_Sorry_MissJackson
body: I’m sorry but are you saying Intuit, the software company that makes TurboTax, is responsible for our complicated tax code? They have nothing to do with tax laws. They provide a product that makes it very easy to file taxes for noobs and experienced people alike. Taxes have been complicated since our government has made it so complicated for the past multiple decades. It was complicated before TurboTax existed.

author: Thin-Course-4054
body: dude is a sales rep for intuit

author: ppp475
body: Intuit has (successfully) lobbied multiple times for increased complexity in the tax code. They didn't start it, but they definitely made it worse.

author: mrob2
body: A lot of countries that still use cash have automatic taxes already. The reason the IS doesn’t is because of intuit and HR Block’s lobbying to keep it that way.

author: Im_Sorry_MissJackson
body: LOL I don’t care about intuit or TurboTax.. Just seems silly to me that people blame them for offering a product that makes filing taxes easier, it is a legit service that obviously a lot of ppl find valuable

author: Aelsar
body:
All in 4/16 JNPR 26C

Large IHS on the daily and weekly chart. Expecting the breakout to bring us to 27-28 a share

author: Ironleg01
body:
There are still reasonably valued equities. Mostly your usual value names, some older tech companies and there are few currently hated companies. 
Value ones are some defence names like GD or RTX, I think they are still cheap, there are others too. Then old tech companies (but not necessarily bad ones) are HPE, JNPR, CSCO and few others. Finally hated names (I love buying hated but good companies for cheap) are INTC, GM and few others. There are some special situations too (like VRSK still hasn't fully recovered) and internationally there are interesting equities as well priced cheap. Popular names are expensive but they are popular so... But if you look outside of what people talk about on Reddit you can find some value.

author: Formal_Ground
body: JNPR gonna moon so fucking hard Monday

author: dr3amboy3657
body:
Cramer said it once on taxes.  Don’t worry about not paying the taxes so much, the market might take care of that for you.  What that means is that say your stock is @100 and you sell now and pay 35% in taxes or hold it and the stock goes down to 70 anyway.  

Now, the example is too simple but that’s the concept.  I like what the other OP said to reset your cost basis every now and then so it becomes more manageable.  It has become a huge problem for me too.   I too have massive long LGTC >500k on a stock that I’m not sure I want to hold for the next 5 years just so I can sell ~100k a year to reduce taxes.

You say TODAY you want to hold MSFT for a long time but at some point, you will have to pay the taxes.  MSFT might not be around when you retire in 20-30 years.  Just because MSFT has been doing well for the last 5 years doesn’t mean it will do well the next 25.   What if you had massive capital gains in Yahoo, Enron, Xom, Cisco, juniper, ibm, or GME(lol)?   Some are long gone and some have became dead money for years.

author: metnavman
body: So you're selling 4/16 26c CCs on JNPR eh?
